image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Philadelphia, Philadelphia County, Pa., September 3, 1950; graduated from William Penn Charter School, Philadelphia, Pa.; B.A., Boston University, Boston, Mass., 1972; J.D., Temple University, Philadelphia, Pa., 1986; United States Army Reserve, 1970-1976; member of the Pennsylvania state house of representatives, 1977-1984; Montgomery County, Pa., commissioner, 1992-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2005); was not a candidate for reelection in 2004, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Sixteenth Congress in 2018.

researchRecord.name: 1984-1986, 6 commercials on 2 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials used during Joe Hoeffel's campaigns for the 1984 and 1986 U.S. congressional elections in District 13 of Pennsylvania, Democratic Party.
